meanings.definition: Capable of living or surviving before the expected time of viability.
meanings.sent1: The tiny bird was previable, showing strength beyond its size.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the previable fetus would need special care.
meanings.sent3: The previable plant surprised everyone by blooming early.
meanings.sent4: Her previable determination to succeed was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The previable seedling pushed through the soil with determination.

meanings.definition: Not able to survive outside the womb before the expected time of viability.
meanings.sent1: The previable kitten needed constant attention to thrive.
meanings.sent2: The medical team discussed the challenges of caring for a previable infant.
meanings.sent3: The previable puppy tried to bark but only managed a squeak.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes for the project were previable, given the limited resources.
meanings.sent5: The previable tadpole struggled in the shallow water, unable to swim properly.
